article:
Ketanji Brown Jackson

Ketanji Brown Jackson is an American lawyer and jurist serving as an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States. She was nominated by President Joe Biden on February 25, 2022, and confirmed by the Senate on April 7, 2022.

#Early life and education

Ketanji Onyika Brown was born on September 14, 1970, in Washington, D.C. to Ketanji Brown, a school administrator, and Johnny Brown, a judge. She grew up in a middle-class family and was raised in a Christian household. Jackson's parents divorced when she was young, and she was raised by her mother, who later remarried.

Jackson attended the Georgetown Day School, a private co-educational day school in Washington, D.C. She was an active member of the school's debate team and was recognized as one of the top debaters in the nation. After graduating from high school in 1988, Jackson was accepted into Harvard University, where she majored in government and African and African American Studies. She graduated magna cum laude in 1992.

Jackson then attended Harvard Law School, where she earned her Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree in 1996. During her time at law school, she was an editor of the Harvard Law Review and was a member of the student-run advocacy group, the Harvard Civil Rights-Civil Liberties Law Review. After graduating from law school, Jackson clerked for Judge Patti B. Saris of the United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts and then for Judge Stephen F. Williams of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit.

#Early career

After completing her clerkship, Jackson worked as an associate at the law firm Goodwin Procter in Washington, D.C. from 1999 to 2005. She then joined the U.S. Department of Justice, where she worked as an assistant U.S. attorney in the Public Integrity Section from 2005 to 2007. In 2007, Jackson joined the private law firm Morrison & Foerster, where she worked as a litigation associate until 2010.

#U.S. Sentencing Commission (2010–2014)

In 2010, Jackson was appointed to the U.S. Sentencing Commission by President Barack Obama. She served on the commission from 2010 to 2014, during which time she played a key role in reforming the federal sentencing guidelines. Jackson was a strong advocate for reducing the disparities in sentencing between different districts and for increasing the use of alternative sentencing options, such as community service and probation.

#District Court (2013–2021)

In 2013, Jackson was nominated by President Obama to serve as a U.S. District Judge for the District of Columbia. She was confirmed by the Senate on October 29, 2013, and took the oath of office on November 12, 2013. During her time on the district court, Jackson presided over a number of high-profile cases, including a civil rights lawsuit against the District of Columbia and a dispute over the implementation of the Affordable Care Act.

##Selected rulings

One of Jackson's notable rulings as a district court judge was in the case of _United States v. Concepcion_. In this case, Jackson held that the government's use of a mandatory minimum sentence was unconstitutional because it did not provide sufficient guidance to the sentencing court. This ruling was seen as a significant victory for defendants' rights and highlighted Jackson's commitment to upholding the Constitution.

Another notable ruling was in the case of _Johnson v. District of Columbia_. In this case, Jackson held that the District of Columbia's use of a "stop-and-frisk" policy was unconstitutional because it did not provide sufficient justification for the stops. This ruling was seen as a significant victory for civil rights and highlighted Jackson's commitment to upholding the Fourth Amendment.

#U.S. Court of Appeals (2021–2022)

In 2021, Jackson was nominated by President Joe Biden to serve on the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit. She was confirmed by the Senate on June 29, 2021, and took the oath of office on July 9, 2021. During her time on the court of appeals, Jackson presided over a number of high-profile cases, including a dispute over the constitutionality of a district court's decision to block a Trump administration policy.

#Nomination to the Supreme Court

On February 25, 2022, President Biden nominated Jackson to serve as an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States. The nomination was widely seen as a historic moment, as Jackson would be the first African American woman to serve on the Court. Jackson's nomination was praised by many, including civil rights leaders and liberal politicians, who saw her as a strong advocate for justice and equality.

#U.S. Supreme Court (2022–present)

On April 7, 2022, the Senate confirmed Jackson's nomination, and she took the oath of office as an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court. Jackson is the first African American woman to serve on the Court and is widely seen as a trailblazer for future generations of lawyers and judges.

##Labor disputes

One of Jackson's first significant opinions as a Supreme Court Justice was in the case of _National Labor Relations Board v. Columbia University_. In this case, Jackson held that the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) had the authority to require a university to recognize a union as the representative of its graduate student employees. This ruling was seen as a significant victory for labor rights and highlighted Jackson's commitment to upholding the National Labor Relations Act.

##Affirmative action

In the case of _Students for Fair Admissions v. Harvard University_, Jackson authored a concurring opinion that argued that the use of affirmative action policies by Harvard University was constitutional. This opinion was seen as a significant victory for advocates of affirmative action and highlighted Jackson's commitment to upholding the principles of diversity and inclusion.

##Judicial philosophy

Jackson's judicial philosophy has been described as liberal and progressive. She has been a strong advocate for justice and equality, and has been critical of policies and practices that she believes are unfair or discriminatory. Jackson has also been a strong advocate for the rights of women and minorities, and has been praised for her commitment to upholding the Constitution.

#Personal life

Jackson is married to Patrick G. Jackson, a lawyer who works as a partner at the law firm Kirkland & Ellis. The couple has two children together. Jackson is a member of the Alpha Kappa Alpha sorority and has been recognized for her community service and philanthropic work.

##Affiliations

Jackson is a member of the American Bar Association, the National Bar Association, and the District of Columbia Bar Association. She has also been a member of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP) and the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU).

#Selected works

Jackson has written a number of articles and essays on topics related to law and justice. Some of her selected works include:

* "The Need for Reform in the Federal Sentencing Guidelines" (2010)
* "The Role of the Judiciary in Promoting Justice and Equality" (2015)
* "The Importance of Affirmative Action in Promoting Diversity and Inclusion" (2019)

article:
**Concerns and Controversies at the 2022 Winter Olympics**

The 2022 Winter Olympics, held in Beijing, China, were marred by a multitude of concerns and controversies. From the selection of the host city to the participation of athletes, the games were shrouded in controversy.

**Criticism of Host Selection**

The selection of Beijing as the host city for the 2022 Winter Olympics was met with criticism from various quarters. The International Olympic Committee (IOC) awarded the hosting rights to Beijing in 2015, despite concerns over the city's human rights record.

**Organizing Concerns and Controversies**

### Cost and Climate

The cost of hosting the Olympics in Beijing was estimated to be around $3.5 billion, a significant increase from the initial estimate of $2.5 billion. The high cost was attributed to the construction of new infrastructure, including venues, hotels, and transportation systems. The climate in Beijing also posed a challenge, with the city experiencing a severe cold snap during the games, forcing organizers to adjust the schedule and logistics.

### Promotional Song

The promotional song for the 2022 Winter Olympics, titled "You and Me", was criticized for its lyrics and melody. The song was seen as a symbol of China's cultural imperialism, with some critics accusing the country of using the Olympics to promote its own values and interests.

**Diplomatic Boycotts or Non-Attendance**

### Background

The 2022 Winter Olympics were the subject of a diplomatic boycott, with several countries announcing that they would not send their top officials to the games. The boycott was a result of the human rights situation in China, particularly in the Xinjiang region, where the Chinese government has been accused of committing genocide against the Uyghur Muslim minority.

### United States

The United States was one of the countries that announced a diplomatic boycott of the 2022 Winter Olympics. The move was seen as a response to China's human rights record, particularly its treatment of Uyghur Muslims.

### Australia

Australia also announced a diplomatic boycott of the 2022 Winter Olympics, citing concerns over China's human rights record.

### India

India did not send its top officials to the 2022 Winter Olympics, citing concerns over China's human rights record.

### Calls for Boycotts by Other Countries

Several other countries, including the United Kingdom, Canada, and New Zealand, were also called upon to boycott the 2022 Winter Olympics due to China's human rights record.

### Chinese Government Response

The Chinese government responded to the diplomatic boycott by accusing the Western countries of hypocrisy and double standards. The government argued that the countries that were boycotting the Olympics were themselves guilty of human rights abuses.

### IOC Response

The International Olympic Committee (IOC) responded to the diplomatic boycott by stating that it respected the decision of each country to participate or not participate in the games.

**Athletes and Team Officials Complaints**

### Quarantine Facilities

Athletes and team officials complained about the quarantine facilities at the 2022 Winter Olympics. The facilities were seen as inadequate, with some athletes reporting that they were not provided with proper food, water, and sanitation.

### Food

Athletes also complained about the food provided at the 2022 Winter Olympics. The food was seen as unappetizing and lacking in nutritional value.

### Weather Conditions

The weather conditions at the 2022 Winter Olympics were also a concern, with athletes complaining about the cold temperatures and snow conditions.

**Team Russia**

### Russian Invasion of Ukraine

The 2022 Winter Olympics were held just weeks after Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The invasion sparked widespread condemnation from around the world, and the International Olympic Committee (IOC) was criticized for not taking a stronger stance against Russia.

**Environmental and Health Issues**

### Effects of the COVID-19 Pandemic

The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on the 2022 Winter Olympics, with many athletes and team officials testing positive for the virus. The pandemic also led to a significant increase in costs, as organizers were forced to implement additional health and safety measures.

### Insufficient Snowfall

The 2022 Winter Olympics were also affected by insufficient snowfall, with some events being delayed or cancelled due to lack of snow.

### Energy Crisis

China was experiencing an energy crisis during the 2022 Winter Olympics, with the country facing severe power cuts. The crisis was attributed to a combination of factors, including a shortage of coal and a reliance on dirty energy sources.

### Impact on Songshan National Nature Reserve

The 2022 Winter Olympics had a significant impact on the Songshan National Nature Reserve, with some athletes and team officials complaining about the lack of natural snow and the destruction of the ecosystem.

**Human Rights Issues**

### Sportswashing

The 2022 Winter Olympics were accused of being a form of sportswashing, with China using the games to promote its own values and interests while ignoring human rights abuses.

### Athlete Safety

Athletes at the 2022 Winter Olympics were concerned about their safety, with some reporting that they were not provided with adequate security measures.

### Athletes' Freedom of Speech

Athletes at the 2022 Winter Olympics were also concerned about their freedom of speech, with some reporting that they were not allowed to express their opinions freely.

### Protests

There were several protests during the 2022 Winter Olympics, with athletes and activists calling for greater attention to be paid to human rights abuses in China.

**Propaganda and Information Operations Issues**

### Propaganda and Information Operations

The 2022 Winter Olympics were accused of being used as a platform for propaganda and information operations, with China using the games to promote its own values and interests while spreading disinformation.

### Censorship

The 2022 Winter Olympics were also marked by censorship, with some athletes and team officials reporting that they were not allowed to express their opinions freely.

### Negative News Censored During the Games

Negative news was censored during the 2022 Winter Olympics, with some reports of human rights abuses and other controversies being suppressed.

### Alleged Suspension of US Athlete's Twitter Account

### Espionage Directed at Athletes

### Sjoerd den Daas Incident

The 2022 Winter Olympics were marred by the Sjoerd den Daas incident, in which a Dutch speed skater was accused of sabotaging his own teammate's chances of winning a medal.

**Olympic Torch Relay**

The Olympic torch relay was a major controversy at the 2022 Winter Olympics, with some athletes and team officials complaining about the lack of transparency and the presence of Chinese security forces.

**Hanbok Row**

article:
**Cultural Impact of Taylor Swift**

Taylor Swift is a multi-platinum, award-winning American singer-songwriter and pop culture icon. With a career spanning over a decade, Swift has become a household name, breaking numerous records and pushing the boundaries of the music industry. Her cultural impact extends far beyond her music, influencing fashion, social media, and popular culture as a whole.

**# Fame and Stardom**

Swift's rise to fame began in 2006 with the release of her debut album, which was moderately successful. However, it was her subsequent albums, particularly _Fearless_ (2008) and _Speak Now_ (2010), that catapulted her to stardom. Her subsequent albums, _Red_ (2012), _1989_ (2014), _Reputation_ (2017), and _Lover_ (2019), solidified her position as a global superstar.

## **Cultural presence**

Swift's cultural presence is undeniable. She has been named one of Time Magazine's 100 most influential people in the world, and has appeared on numerous "most beautiful" and "most powerful" lists. Her influence extends beyond the music industry, with her fashion sense and personal style emulated by millions. Swift has also been a vocal advocate for social justice, using her platform to raise awareness and support for various causes.

## **American symbol**

Swift has become an American cultural icon, embodying the values of hard work, determination, and individuality. Her rags-to-riches story, from small-town girl to global superstar, is an inspiration to many. Swift's music often explores themes of American identity, love, and heartbreak, resonating with audiences across the country.

## **Tributes and honorifics**

Swift has received numerous tributes and honorifics, including multiple Grammy Awards, American Music Awards, and Billboard Music Awards. She has also been named one of the best-selling music artists of all time, with over 100 million records sold worldwide. In 2019, she was awarded the National Medal of Arts, the highest award given to artists and patrons of the arts in the United States.

**# Musicianship**

Swift's musicianship has been a key factor in her success. She is a skilled singer, songwriter, and musician, known for her versatility and ability to blend different styles and genres.

## **Country music revival**

Swift's early music was rooted in country, and she is often credited with helping to revive the genre. Her country-pop sound has influenced a new generation of artists, and her music has been praised for its storytelling and authenticity.

## **Poptimism**

Swift's music has also been associated with the poptimist movement, which emphasizes the value of popular music and challenges traditional notions of high art. Her pop-infused sound has been praised for its catchiness and accessibility, appealing to a wide range of audiences.

## **Versatility**

Swift's musicianship is characterized by her versatility, ability to blend different styles and genres. She has explored country, pop, rock, and electronic sounds, collaborating with artists from various backgrounds.

## **Writing**

Swift is a skilled songwriter, known for her ability to craft relatable, introspective lyrics. Her songs often explore themes of love, heartbreak, and self-discovery, resonating with audiences worldwide.

**# Commercial success**

Swift's commercial success is unparalleled. She has broken numerous records, including the most American Music Awards won by a female artist, and the most No. 1 albums on the Billboard 200 chart.

## **Domestic**

Swift's domestic success is remarkable, with multiple No. 1 albums and singles on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. She has also broken numerous records on the American Music Awards, including the most awards won by a female artist.

## **International**

Swift's international success is equally impressive, with multiple No. 1 albums and singles on the charts in countries such as the United Kingdom, Australia, and Canada. She has also broken numerous records on the International Federation of the Phonographic Industry (IFPI) charts.

## **Streaming**

Swift's streaming success is a testament to her enduring popularity. She has broken numerous records on platforms such as Spotify and Apple Music, including the most streams in a single week.

## **Physical**

Swift's physical album sales are also impressive, with multiple No. 1 albums on the Billboard 200 chart. She has also broken numerous records on the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) charts.

## **Peers**

Swift's peers have praised her talent and dedication to her craft. She has collaborated with numerous artists, including Justin Vernon, The Dixie Chicks, and Calvin Harris.

**# Entrepreneurship**

Swift's entrepreneurial spirit is evident in her approach to her career. She has built a brand that extends beyond her music, incorporating fashion, social media, and philanthropy.

## **Name and brand**

Swift's name and brand are synonymous with music, fashion, and popular culture. She has collaborated with numerous brands, including Apple, Target, and Coca-Cola.

## **Social media presence**

Swift's social media presence is significant, with millions of followers across platforms such as Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook. She uses her platform to engage with fans, share her music, and promote her brand.

## **Album cycles**

Swift's album cycles are closely followed by fans and critics alike. She has released multiple albums, each with its own unique sound and theme.

## **Corporate relations**

Swift's corporate relations are complex, with partnerships and endorsements with numerous companies. She has also been involved in various philanthropic efforts, including the Taylor Swift Foundation.

**# Industry and economy**

Swift's impact on the music industry and economy is significant. She has challenged traditional industry norms, pushing the boundaries of streaming, intellectual property, and distribution models.

## **Challenging industry norms**

Swift's approach to her career has challenged traditional industry norms, including the way artists are compensated for their work. She has been a vocal advocate for artists' rights, pushing for fair pay and better working conditions.

### **Streaming reforms**

Swift's criticism of streaming platforms has led to reforms, including changes to the way artists are paid for their music.

### **Intellectual property**

Swift's approach to intellectual property has been influential, with her use of copyright to protect her music and lyrics.

### **Distribution models**

Swift's criticism of traditional distribution models has led to changes, including the rise of independent labels and artist-owned distribution companies.

**# Press and media**

Swift's relationship with the press and media is complex, with both positive and negative interactions. She has been the subject of numerous profiles and features, including a 2019 Vanity Fair cover story.

**# Creative inspiration**

Swift's creative inspiration is diverse, drawing from sources such as literature, art, and music. She has cited artists such as Joni Mitchell, Fleetwood Mac, and Taylor Dayne as influences.

**# Fandom**

Swift's fandom is dedicated and passionate, with fans known for their energy and enthusiasm. The Swifties have been praised for their creativity and dedication, with numerous fan art, fan fiction, and charity projects.

**# Cross-cultural effect**

Swift's music and brand have had a cross-cultural effect, influencing audiences worldwide. She has collaborated with artists from diverse backgrounds, including Kendrick Lamar, Justin Vernon, and Ed Sheeran.

**# Scholarly interest**

Swift's impact on music, culture, and society has sparked scholarly interest, with numerous academic programs and research initiatives focusing on her career and influence.

## **Academic programs**

Swift's influence has led to the development of academic programs, including courses on pop music studies, cultural studies, and music industry management.

In conclusion, Taylor Swift's cultural impact is profound and far-reaching, extending beyond her music to influence fashion, social media, and popular culture. Her entrepreneurial spirit, dedication to her craft, and commitment to social justice have made her a household name and a global superstar.

**Leland Sklar**

Leland Sklar is an American bassist, best known for his work as a session musician and as a member of the rock band Toto. With a career spanning over five decades, Sklar has established himself as one of the most in-demand and respected bassists in the music industry.

**Early life**

Born on September 14, 1947, in Los Angeles, California, Sklar grew up in a musical family. His mother was a music teacher, and his father was a musician who played the saxophone. Sklar began playing music at a young age, learning to play the guitar and bass. He attended the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), where he studied music and began to develop his skills as a bassist.

**Career**

Sklar's music career began in the late 1960s, playing in various rock and pop bands in the Los Angeles area. He eventually landed a job as a session musician, working with artists such as Elton John, James Taylor, and Crosby, Stills & Nash. In the 1970s, Sklar became a member of the rock band Toto, which was formed by Steve Lukather, David Paich, and Jeff Porcaro. During his time with Toto, Sklar played on many of the band's most successful albums, including "Toto IV" and "Isolation".

In addition to his work with Toto, Sklar has played on numerous other albums, including those by Elton John, James Taylor, and Steely Dan. He has also worked as a solo artist, releasing several albums of his own music.

# Saint Lucia

Saint Lucia is a sovereign island country in the eastern Caribbean Sea on the boundary with the Atlantic Ocean. The island nation is home to a population of around 178,000 people. Saint Lucia is known for its lush tropical rainforests, rugged volcanic peaks, and pristine beaches. The island has a rich history, with evidence of human habitation dating back to the pre-colonial era.

# Etymology

The name "Saint Lucia" is derived from the Latin name of the island, "Santa Lucia," which was given by Christopher Columbus in 1502. The island was named after Saint Lucy, a 4th-century martyr who is revered in many Catholic countries. Over time, the name was adapted to "Saint Lucia" to reflect the island's cultural and linguistic heritage.

# History

## Pre-colonial period

The first inhabitants of Saint Lucia were the Arawak people, who migrated to the island from the mainland in the 1st millennium AD. The Arawaks established a thriving society on the island, with a complex system of government and a strong spiritual tradition. They were skilled farmers, fishermen, and craftsmen, and their culture had a lasting impact on the island's history.

## Early European period

In 1498, Christopher Columbus arrived on the island, and it was subsequently claimed by Spain. However, the Spanish failed to establish a permanent settlement on the island, and it was later ceded to France in 1660. The French established a series of fortifications and plantations on the island, and they introduced enslaved Africans to work on the plantations.

## 18th and 19th centuries

During the 18th and 19th centuries, Saint Lucia became a major producer of sugar, coffee, and indigo. The island's economy was heavily dependent on the transatlantic slave trade, and many enslaved Africans were brought to the island to work on the plantations. The island was also the site of several battles between the French and the British, who eventually gained control of the island in 1814.

## 20th century

In the early 20th century, Saint Lucia began to move towards independence. The island gained internal self-government in 1967, and it became an associated state of the United Kingdom in 1967. In 1979, Saint Lucia gained full independence from the UK, with Sir John Compton as its first prime minister.

## Post-independence era

Since independence, Saint Lucia has maintained a stable democracy and a market-based economy. The island has also made significant progress in areas such as education, healthcare, and infrastructure development. In 2011, the island's Prime Minister, Stephenson King, launched a new national development plan, which aims to promote economic growth and social development.

# Geography

## Climate

Saint Lucia has a tropical climate, with average temperatures ranging from 23°C to 28°C throughout the year. The island is susceptible to hurricanes, which can bring strong winds and heavy rainfall. The dry season runs from December to May, while the wet season runs from June to November.

## Geology

Saint Lucia is a volcanic island, with a rugged terrain and numerous peaks. The island's highest peak, Gros Piton, rises to 950 meters above sea level. The island is also home to several hot springs and geysers, which are a result of the volcanic activity.

# Government

## Administrative divisions

Saint Lucia is divided into 11 administrative districts, each with its own local government. The districts are: Anse-la-Raye, Castries, Choiseul, Dauphin, Dennery, Gros-Islet, Laborie, Micoud, Praslin, Soufrière, and Vieux-Fort.

## Law and crime

Saint Lucia has a relatively low crime rate compared to other countries in the region. However, the island has experienced a rise in violent crime in recent years, including armed robberies and homicides. The island's police force is responsible for maintaining law and order, and they work closely with other regional and international agencies to combat crime.

## Foreign relations

Saint Lucia is a member of several regional and international organizations, including the Commonwealth of Nations, the Organization of Eastern Caribbean States, and the Caribbean Community. The island has also established diplomatic relations with several countries, including the United Kingdom, the United States, and Canada.

# Economy

## Tourism

Tourism is a major contributor to Saint Lucia's economy, with millions of visitors arriving on the island each year. The island's pristine beaches, lush rainforests, and vibrant culture make it a popular destination for tourists. The island's tourism industry is also supported by a range of infrastructure, including hotels, resorts, and attractions.

## Agriculture

Agriculture is another significant sector of the island's economy, with crops such as bananas, mangoes, and avocados being major exports. The island's fertile soil and favorable climate make it an ideal location for agriculture, and the sector is supported by a range of infrastructure, including irrigation systems and storage facilities.

## Infrastructure

Saint Lucia has invested heavily in its infrastructure, including roads, bridges, and ports. The island's Hewanorra International Airport is a major hub for the region, and it offers flights to several destinations in the Caribbean and beyond. The island's ports are also an important hub for trade and commerce, with cargo ships arriving from around the world.

# Demographics

## Ethnic groups

Saint Lucia has a diverse population, with several ethnic groups represented. The island's population is predominantly of African descent, with a smaller proportion of European, Asian, and indigenous American ancestry. The island's population is also divided into several distinct ethnic groups, including the Saint Lucian Creole, the French, and the British.

## Languages

The official language of Saint Lucia is English, but the island's population also speaks a range of creole languages, including Saint Lucian Creole and French-based creoles. Many islanders also speak French and other languages, reflecting the island's colonial history.

## Religion

The majority of Saint Lucians are Christian, with a significant proportion of the population identifying as Roman Catholic. Other Christian denominations, including Anglican, Methodist, and Baptist, are also represented on the island. The island's population is also home to a small but significant Muslim community.

## Education

Education is highly valued in Saint Lucia, and the island has a well-developed education system. The island's education system is based on the British model, and it offers a range of qualifications, including the Caribbean Secondary Education Certificate (CSEC) and the Caribbean Advanced Proficiency Examination (CAPE). The island's education system is supported by a range of infrastructure, including schools, libraries, and educational resources.

## Healthcare

The island's healthcare system is well-developed, with a range of medical facilities and services available. The island's healthcare system is based on the British model, and it offers a range of medical services, including primary care, specialist care, and emergency services. The island's healthcare system is supported by a range of infrastructure, including hospitals, clinics, and medical equipment.

# Culture

## Media

The island's media landscape is diverse, with several newspapers, radio stations, and television stations available. The island's media is largely independent, and it plays an important role in shaping public opinion and promoting the island's culture.

## Music

Music is an important part of Saint Lucian culture, with a range of traditional and modern styles represented. The island's music is influenced by its African and European heritage, and it features a range of instruments, including the steel drum, the guitar, and the drum. The island's music is also characterized by its use of calypso and soca rhythms, which are an important part of the island's cultural heritage.

## Food

The island's cuisine is a fusion of African, European, and indigenous American influences, and it features a range of traditional dishes, including jerk chicken, fried fish, and pepper pot soup. The island's cuisine is also characterized by its use of fresh seafood, including lobster, crab, and shrimp.

## Sports

Sports are an important part of Saint Lucian culture, with a range of traditional and modern sports represented. The island's national sports include cricket, football, and netball, which are all popular among islanders. The island's sports scene is also supported by a range of infrastructure, including stadiums, sports facilities, and equipment.

article:
2023 Toronto mayoral by-election

The 2023 Toronto mayoral by-election was a by-election held on February 18, 2023, to fill the vacant position of Mayor of Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The by-election was the result of the resignation of John Tory, who had served as Mayor since 2014.

Background

### Resignation of John Tory and subsequent vacancy

On February 3, 2023, John Tory announced his resignation as Mayor of Toronto, effective immediately. This move came after weeks of controversy surrounding a romantic relationship Tory had with a woman who was significantly younger than him. Tory stated that his decision to step down was in the best interest of the city and its residents, and he would not be seeking re-election.

Following Tory's resignation, the City of Toronto's Clerk, Uma Apte, confirmed that a by-election would be held to fill the vacant position. The by-election was scheduled to take place on February 18, 2023.

### By-election process

The by-election process was governed by the City of Toronto Act, 1997, which outlines the procedures for filling vacancies in municipal office. Under the Act, a by-election is required to be held within 60 days of a vacancy occurring. The Clerk of the City of Toronto was responsible for organizing and administering the by-election, including the nomination of candidates and the conduct of voting.

Mayoral debates

Prior to the by-election, several debates were held among the candidates vying for the position of Mayor. These debates were moderated by local media outlets and provided an opportunity for candidates to share their vision for Toronto and respond to questions from voters.

Several debates were held, including a debate hosted by the Toronto Board of Trade and a debate sponsored by the Toronto Star. These debates drew significant attention and were widely covered in the local media.

#### Endorsements

* The Toronto Star endorsing Olivia Chow
* The Toronto Sun endorsing Giorgio Mammoliti

Opinion polls

Several opinion polls were conducted in the lead-up to the by-election. These polls showed a range of candidates in the lead, including:

* A poll conducted by Ipsos in January 2023 showed Olivia Chow leading with 31% support
* A poll conducted by Abacus Data in February 2023 showed Ana Bailão leading with 29% support

Results

The results of the 2023 Toronto mayoral by-election were as follows:

* Ana Bailão: 45.4% of the vote
* Olivia Chow: 42.1% of the vote
* Giorgio Mammoliti: 6.4% of the vote
* Other candidates: 6.1% of the vote

Ana Bailão was declared the winner of the by-election and was sworn in as the new Mayor of Toronto on February 21, 2023.

article:
Flowers (Miley Cyrus song)

Flowers is a song by American singer Miley Cyrus, released on January 13, 2023, through Columbia Records and RCA Records. It was written by Cyrus, along with the song's producers, Troy Nørgård and Michael Pollack. The song serves as the lead single from Cyrus' seventh studio album, Endless Summer Vacation.

# Production and release

The production of "Flowers" began in 2021, during the COVID-19 pandemic. Cyrus had been working on new music with various producers, including Troy Nørgård, who would go on to co-produce the song. The song's title, "Flowers," was reportedly inspired by a conversation Cyrus had with her team about the idea of growth and renewal.

"Flowers" was released as a single on January 13, 2023, to positive reviews from music critics. The song's release was accompanied by a music video, which was directed by Cyrus and Nørgård. The video features Cyrus performing the song in various settings, including a garden and a beach.

# Composition

"Flowers" is a pop song with a tempo of 100 beats per minute. The song features a simple, yet effective, melody, with a focus on Cyrus' vocal performance. Lyrically, the song explores themes of growth, renewal, and the passing of time.

The song's composition is notable for its use of atmospheric instrumentation, including a prominent use of synthesizers and a minimalist drum pattern. Cyrus' vocal performance is also noteworthy, with the singer delivering a nuanced and emotive performance.

# Critical reception

## Reviews

"Flowers" received widespread critical acclaim upon its release. Many reviewers praised the song's catchy melody, Cyrus' vocal performance, and the song's atmospheric instrumentation. Some reviewers noted that the song's lyrics were somewhat vague, but overall, the song was seen as a strong return for Cyrus after a period of relative quiet.

## Year-end rankings

"Flowers" appeared on several year-end lists, including Rolling Stone's 100 Best Songs of 2023, where it ranked at number 14. The song also appeared on Billboard's 10 Best Songs of 2023, where it ranked at number 6.

# Commercial performance

## North America

"Flowers" was a commercial success in North America, debuting at number one on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. The song stayed at number one for seven consecutive weeks, becoming Cyrus' longest-running number-one single in the US. The song also reached number one on the Canadian Hot 100 chart.

## International

"Flowers" was also successful internationally, reaching number one on the UK Singles Chart and the Australian Singles Chart. The song also reached the top 10 in several other countries, including Germany, France, and Italy.

# Music video

The music video for "Flowers" was directed by Cyrus and Nørgård. The video features Cyrus performing the song in various settings, including a garden and a beach. The video was shot in a cinematic style, with a focus on capturing the song's atmospheric instrumentation and Cyrus' emotional vocal performance.

# Performances and usage

## Live performances

Cyrus has performed "Flowers" live on several occasions, including at the 2023 Grammy Awards, where she performed the song as part of a medley of her hits. The song has also been performed on Cyrus' Endless Summer Vacation Tour, which kicked off in 2023.

## Usage in media

"Flowers" has been featured in several TV shows and movies, including the HBO series Euphoria, where the song was used in a pivotal scene. The song has also been used in several commercials and promotional videos.

# Impact

"Flowers" has had a significant impact on the music industry, with many critics praising the song's catchy melody and Cyrus' vocal performance. The song's success has also helped to establish Cyrus as a leading artist in the pop genre.

# Lawsuit

In January 2023, Cyrus was sued by a former producer, who claimed that she had failed to pay him for his work on the song. The lawsuit was later settled out of court.

# Cover versions

"Flowers" has been covered by several artists, including country singer Kacey Musgraves and pop singer Halsey. The song has also been featured on several amateur covers on YouTube and other social media platforms.

# Accolades

"Flowers" won several awards, including the Grammy Award for Best Pop Solo Performance and the MTV Video Music Award for Best Pop Video.

# Credits and personnel

## Recording

* Miley Cyrus – lead vocals, songwriting
* Troy Nørgård – production, songwriting
* Michael Pollack – songwriting
* Brian Garten – engineering
* Chris Gehringer – mastering

## Personnel

2022 Korea Open (badminton)

The 2022 Korea Open was a badminton tournament that took place from June 21 to June 26, 2022, in Incheon, South Korea. The tournament was an international level badminton competition that was part of the BWF World Tour.

Venue
-------

The tournament was held at the Songdo Convensia in Incheon, South Korea. The venue has a seating capacity of 5,000 spectators and features 10 badminton courts.

* Singles: 9,200 points

article:
**Death and State Funeral of Elizabeth II**

The death of Elizabeth II, the longest-reigning British monarch, on 8 September 2022, at the age of 96, marked the end of an era in the United Kingdom and beyond. The subsequent state funeral and national mourning period were unprecedented in scale and scope, reflecting the monarch's extraordinary life, reign, and impact on the Commonwealth.

**Background**

Elizabeth II was born on 21 April 1926 to Prince Albert, Duke of York, and his wife, Elizabeth, Duchess of York. She ascended to the throne on 6 February 1952 following the death of her father, King George VI. Her 70-year reign was marked by significant historical events, including decolonization, the Cold War, and the rise of the Commonwealth.

**Death and National Mourning**

### Death and Announcement

Elizabeth II passed away peacefully at Balmoral Castle in Aberdeenshire, Scotland, at 08:30 BST on 8 September 2022. The news was announced by Buckingham Palace at 16:30 BST, sparking an outpouring of tributes and condolences from around the world.

### Scottish Events

The Queen's death was met with shock and sadness in Scotland, where she had spent many summers at Balmoral Castle. Thousands of people gathered at the castle to pay their respects, and a book of condolences was opened at St Giles' Cathedral in Edinburgh.

### Lying-in-State

The Queen's coffin was taken from Balmoral Castle to Edinburgh, where it lay in rest at St Giles' Cathedral from 9 to 11 September. On 12 September, the coffin was flown to London, where it was taken to the Palace of Holyroodhouse for a vigil by the King's Guard. The coffin was then taken to Westminster Hall, where it lay in state from 14 to 19 September.

#### Queue

The queue to pay respects to the Queen at Westminster Hall was estimated to be around 7 miles (11 km) long, with some people waiting for up to 24 hours to reach the front. The queue was managed by the Metropolitan Police and was considered one of the largest and most historic in British history.

**State Funeral**

The state funeral of Elizabeth II was held on 19 September 2022 at Westminster Abbey, followed by a committal service at St George's Chapel, Windsor Castle.

### Planning

The planning for the state funeral began in July 2022, with a team of around 200 people involved in the organization. The funeral was designed to be a fitting tribute to the Queen's life and reign, with a procession of dignitaries, a funeral service, and a committal service.

### Procession to Westminster Abbey

The procession from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey was led by the King's Troop Royal Horse Artillery, followed by the Queen's coffin on a gun carriage, escorted by the Household Division. The procession was watched by thousands of people lining the streets of London.

### Funeral Service

The funeral service at Westminster Abbey was conducted by the Dean of Westminster, with the Archbishop of York and the Bishop of London also participating. The service was attended by members of the royal family, dignitaries, and other guests.

### Processions in London and Windsor

Following the funeral service, there were processions in London and Windsor, with the Queen's coffin being taken to Wellington Arch and then to Windsor Castle.

### Committal Service

The committal service was held at St George's Chapel, Windsor Castle, where the Queen's coffin was lowered into the Royal Vault.

### Interment

On 26 March 2023, the Queen's coffin was moved to St George's Chapel, where a requiem mass was held, followed by her burial in the King George VI Memorial Chapel, alongside her husband, Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh.

**Organisation and Media**

### Attendees

The funeral was attended by dignitaries and guests from around the world, including heads of state, royals, and other notable figures.

### Security

The security for the funeral was provided by the Metropolitan Police, with a significant presence on the streets of London and at the venues involved.

### Cost and Economic Impact

The cost of the funeral was estimated to be around £86 million, with some estimates suggesting that the economic impact could be as high as £1 billion.

### Coverage

The funeral was covered by media outlets around the world, with many broadcasting live from London and Windsor. The BBC provided extensive coverage, with a special channel dedicated to the funeral.

#### United Kingdom

The funeral was watched by millions of people in the UK, with the BBC's coverage reaching a peak audience of 28.4 million viewers.

#### Other Countries

The funeral was also watched by millions of people in other countries, including the United States, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand.

#### Viewing Figures

The viewing figures for the funeral were significant, with the BBC's coverage reaching a global audience of over 100 million people.

**Succession and Four-Nation Tour**

### Accession

Following the Queen's death, her eldest son, Charles, Prince of Wales, acceded to the throne, becoming King Charles III.

### Four-Nation Royal Tour

King Charles III embarked on a four-nation royal tour, visiting Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland, and England, to pay his respects to his mother and to meet with the public.

### Other Activities

The King also held a series of meetings with the leaders of the Commonwealth, to discuss the future of the organization and to pay tribute to his mother's legacy.

**Reactions**

The reactions to the Queen's death and funeral were widespread, with many people paying tribute to her life and reign. The outpouring of grief was unprecedented, with many people attending vigils and services to pay their respects.

**Other Commemorations**

### Antigua and Barbuda

The Government of Antigua and Barbuda declared a day of national mourning, with a flag-raising ceremony and a special service at St. John's Cathedral.

### Australia

The Australian Government declared a national day of mourning, with a ceremony at the Australian War Memorial and a special service at St. Andrew's Cathedral, Sydney.

### The Bahamas

article:
**Eileen Gu**

Eileen Gu is a Chinese-American professional freestyle skier who has made a significant impact on the sport in recent years. Born on October 25, 2001, in San Francisco, California, Gu's journey to becoming a world-class athlete began with her early exposure to snow sports in the mountains of California.

**Early life and education**

Eileen Gu's parents, Dr. Sharon Gu and Dr. Joon Gu, are both professors at Stanford University. Her father is a renowned expert in computer science, while her mother is a professor of medicine. Growing up in a family of academics, Gu's early life was marked by a strong emphasis on education and intellectual pursuits. Despite her intellectual inclinations, Gu's passion for sports was evident from a young age.

Gu began skiing at the age of two, and by the time she was five, she was already competing in local ski competitions. Her parents recognized her talent and encouraged her to pursue her passion for skiing. Gu attended Stanford Online High School, a rigorous online program that allowed her to balance her academic responsibilities with her training and competition schedule.

**Sports career**

Gu's rise to prominence in freestyle skiing began when she started competing in the International Ski Federation (FIS) World Cup circuit. Her breakthrough moment came in 2018 when she won the gold medal in the halfpipe event at the FIS Junior World Championships in Chiesa in Valmalenco, Italy.

### Coaches

Gu has worked with several coaches throughout her career, including her father, Joon Gu, who has been instrumental in her training and development. She has also worked with renowned coaches such as Jonny Moseley, a two-time Olympic gold medalist and a member of the U.S. Ski and Snowboard Hall of Fame.

### X Games

Gu made her X Games debut in 2019, competing in the big air event at the X Games Aspen. She finished fifth in the competition, but her performance was enough to earn her a spot on the FIS World Cup circuit. In 2021, Gu won her first X Games gold medal in the big air event at the X Games Chur.

### World Championships

Gu's first World Championships appearance was in 2019, where she competed in the halfpipe event in Park City, Utah. She finished fourth in the competition, but her performance was enough to earn her a spot on the FIS World Cup circuit. In 2021, Gu won her first World Championships gold medal in the big air event in Aspen, Colorado.

### 2022 Winter Olympics

Gu's performance at the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing, China, was a highlight of her career. She competed in the halfpipe and big air events, winning the gold medal in the big air event and finishing fifth in the halfpipe event.

### World Cup results

Gu has been one of the most dominant freestyle skiers on the FIS World Cup circuit in recent years. She has won multiple gold medals in the halfpipe and big air events, and has been a consistent podium finisher throughout her career.

**Nationality and citizenship**

Gu holds dual citizenship of the United States and China. She was born in the United States to Chinese parents, and has spent time living in both countries throughout her life. Gu has spoken publicly about the challenges she has faced as a dual citizen, but has also expressed her love and gratitude for both countries.

**Sponsorships, endorsements, and modeling career**

Gu has partnered with several major brands throughout her career, including Nike, Hillberg & Berk, and Oakley. She has also modeled for several fashion brands, including Dolce & Gabbana and Michael Kors.

**Personal life**

Gu is known for her strong social media presence, with millions of followers on platforms such as Instagram and TikTok. She is also an advocate for social and environmental causes, including climate change and women's empowerment.

### Social and political views

Gu has been open about her views on social and political issues, including climate change and women's rights. She has spoken out against systemic injustices and has used her platform to raise awareness about important issues.

The Eurovision Song Contest 2022 was the 66th edition of the annual Eurovision Song Contest, a competition among member countries of the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) to select the best song of the year. **2022-23 PBA 3x3 Season – Third Conference**

The 2022-23 PBA 3x3 Season – Third Conference is the third conference of the 2022-23 Philippine Basketball Association 3x3 season. The conference began on January 21, 2023, and concluded on February 5, 2023.

**#Teams**

A total of 12 teams participated in the Third Conference. The teams are:

* 1. San Miguel Beermen
* 2. Barangay Ginebra San Miguel
* 3. Meralco Bolts
* 4. NLEX Road Warriors
* 5. TNT Tropang Giga
* 6. Blackwater Bossing
* 7. Magnolia Hotshots
* 8. Alaska Aces
* 9. NorthPort Batang Pier
* 10. Converge FiberXers
* 11. Phoenix Super LPG Fuel Masters
* 12. Terrafirma Dyip

**#1st leg**

The 1st leg of the Third Conference consists of six legs, each with a different format.

##**Groupings**

The teams are divided into four groups, labeled A, B, C, and D.

##**Preliminary round**

The preliminary round is a round-robin format where each team plays the other teams in their group.

###**Pool A**

Pool A consists of the following teams: San Miguel Beermen, Barangay Ginebra San Miguel, Magnolia Hotshots, and Blackwater Bossing.

###**Pool B**

Pool B consists of the following teams: Meralco Bolts, NLEX Road Warriors, TNT Tropang Giga, and Alaska Aces.

###**Pool C**

Pool C consists of the following teams: Converge FiberXers, Phoenix Super LPG Fuel Masters, Terrafirma Dyip, and NorthPort Batang Pier.

###**Pool D**

Pool D consists of the following teams: Magnolia Hotshots, Blackwater Bossing, Alaska Aces, and NLEX Road Warriors.

##**Classification 9th–12th**

The teams that finish last in their respective groups will compete in a classification round to determine the 9th to 12th places.

##**Knockout stage**

The top two teams in each group will advance to the knockout stage, which consists of a bracket format.

###**Bracket**

The bracket will feature a quarterfinals, semifinals, third place game, and finals.

###**Quarterfinals**

The quarterfinals will feature the winners of Pool A vs. the runners-up of Pool C, and the winners of Pool B vs. the runners-up of Pool D.

###**Semifinals**

The semifinals will feature the winners of the quarterfinals.

###**Third place game**

The third place game will feature the losers of the semifinals.

###**Finals**

The finals will feature the winners of the semifinals.

##**Final standings**

The final standings will be determined based on the results of the knockout stage.

**#2nd leg**

The 2nd leg of the Third Conference consists of six legs, each with a different format.

##**Groupings**

**Bridgeport, Connecticut**

Bridgeport is a city located in the state of Connecticut, in the United States. As of the 2020 census, the city has a population of approximately 148,655 people, making it the fifth-largest city in Connecticut. Bridgeport is situated on Long Island Sound, approximately 60 miles northeast of New York City.

**History**

### Colonial History

Bridgeport's history dates back to the colonial era, when the area was first settled in 1639 by a group of English Puritans. The city was originally known as Pequonnock, and was named after the Pequonnock River, which runs through the city. In 1656, the area was officially incorporated as the Town of Pequonnock, and was renamed Bridgeport in 1658.

### 19th Century

During the 19th century, Bridgeport became a major industrial center, with the establishment of a number of factories and manufacturing facilities. The city's economy was driven by the production of textiles, machinery, and other manufactured goods. The city's population grew rapidly during this period, and by the mid-19th century, Bridgeport was one of the largest cities in Connecticut.

### 20th Century

In the 20th century, Bridgeport's economy began to decline, as many of its manufacturing facilities closed or moved out of the city. The city's population also declined, as residents moved to the suburbs in search of better economic opportunities. However, during this period, Bridgeport also experienced significant cultural and artistic growth, with the establishment of a number of museums, galleries, and performance venues.

### 21st Century

In the 21st century, Bridgeport has continued to experience significant challenges, including poverty, crime, and urban decay. However, the city has also made significant efforts to revitalize its economy and improve its quality of life. The city has invested in a number of new businesses and developments, including a new downtown shopping center and a number of affordable housing projects.

### Notable Speeches

In 1968, Martin Luther King Jr. delivered a speech in Bridgeport, in which he called for an end to poverty and racial inequality in the city. The speech was part of a larger effort by King to address the issues of poverty and racism in American cities.

Bridgeport is divided into a number of neighborhoods, each with its own unique character and history. Some of the city's most notable neighborhoods include:

article:
**2022 ICC Men's T20 World Cup Global Qualifier A**

The 2022 ICC Men's T20 World Cup Global Qualifier A was a cricket tournament that took place from September 18 to October 2, 2022, in Oman. It was one of the two global qualifiers for the 2022 ICC Men's T20 World Cup in Australia, with the top team from each qualifier earning a spot in the tournament.

# Squads

A total of 8 teams participated in the Global Qualifier A, each selecting a squad of 15 players. The teams were:

* Bermuda
* Canada
* Hong Kong
* Italy
* Jersey
* Kuwait
* Papua New Guinea
* Singapore

Each team had to submit their squad to the ICC by September 1, 2022.

# Group stage

The group stage consisted of 2 groups, A and B, each containing 4 teams. The teams played each other in a round-robin format, with the top 2 teams from each group advancing to the semi-finals.

## Group A

Group A consisted of the following teams:

* Canada
* Hong Kong
* Italy
* Singapore

The matches played in Group A were:

* Canada vs Hong Kong: Canada won by 7 wickets
* Italy vs Singapore: Italy won by 7 wickets
* Canada vs Italy: Canada won by 82 runs
* Hong Kong vs Singapore: Hong Kong won by 8 wickets
* Canada vs Singapore: Canada won by 43 runs
* Hong Kong vs Italy: Hong Kong won by 8 wickets

## Group B

Group B consisted of the following teams:

* Bermuda
* Jersey
* Kuwait
* Papua New Guinea

The matches played in Group B were:

* Bermuda vs Jersey: Jersey won by 9 wickets
* Kuwait vs Papua New Guinea: Papua New Guinea won by 6 wickets
* Bermuda vs Kuwait: Bermuda won by 6 wickets
* Jersey vs Papua New Guinea: Jersey won by 9 wickets
* Bermuda vs Papua New Guinea: Bermuda won by 49 runs
* Jersey vs Kuwait: Jersey won by 8 wickets

The top 2 teams from each group advanced to the semi-finals.

# Consolation play-offs

The consolation play-offs consisted of 5 matches, with the teams that finished 3rd and 4th in each group competing against each other.

## Bracket

The consolation play-offs bracket was as follows:

* 7th-place play-off: 3rd place Group A vs 3rd place Group B
* 5th-place play-off: 4th place Group A vs 4th place Group B
* 7th-place play-off: Hong Kong vs Kuwait
* 5th-place play-off: Italy vs Papua New Guinea
* 5th-place play-off: Singapore vs Bermuda

## 5th Place semi-finals

The 5th place semi-finals were played between the teams that finished 4th in each group and the teams that finished 3rd in the consolation play-offs.

* Italy vs Bermuda: Italy won by 6 wickets
* Papua New Guinea vs Singapore: Papua New Guinea won by 7 wickets

## 7th-place play-off

The 7th-place play-off was played between Hong Kong and Kuwait.

* Hong Kong vs Kuwait: Hong Kong won by 8 wickets

## 5th-place play-off

The 5th-place play-off was played between Italy and Papua New Guinea.

* Italy vs Papua New Guinea: Italy won by 26 runs

# Play-offs

The play-offs consisted of 5 matches, with the teams that finished 1st and 2nd in each group competing against each other.

## Bracket

The play-offs bracket was as follows:

* Semi-finals: 1st place Group A vs 2nd place Group B, 1st place Group B vs 2nd place Group A
* 3rd-place play-off: 3rd place Group A vs 3rd place Group B
* Final: Winners of the semi-finals

## Semi-finals

The semi-finals were played between the teams that finished 1st in each group and the teams that finished 2nd in the other group.

* Canada vs Jersey: Canada won by 7 wickets
* Hong Kong vs Bermuda: Hong Kong won by 7 wickets

## 3rd-place play-off

The 3rd-place play-off was played between the teams that finished 3rd in each group.

* Italy vs Papua New Guinea: Italy won by 26 runs

## Final

The final was played between the winners of the semi-finals.

* Canada vs Hong Kong: Hong Kong won by 8 wickets

# Final standings

The final standings were as follows:

1. Hong Kong
2. Canada
3. Italy
4. Jersey
5. Bermuda
6. Papua New Guinea
7. Singapore
8. Kuwait

Giorgio Napolitano

Giorgio Napolitano is a Italian politician who served as the President of Italy from 2006 to 2015. He was a prominent figure in the Italian Communist Party and later became a leading member of the Democratic Party.

Early Life

Giorgio Napolitano was born on June 29, 1925, in Naples, Italy, to a family of Italian lawyers and politicians. His father, Giovanni Napolitano, was a lawyer and a member of the Italian Socialist Party. Napolitano's early life was marked by a strong sense of social and political awareness, which was influenced by his family's progressive values.

Early Political Career

During World War II, Napolitano joined the anti-fascist resistance movement, fighting against the fascist regime of Benito Mussolini. He became a member of the Italian Partisans, a group of anti-fascist fighters who were determined to overthrow the regime. Napolitano's involvement in the resistance movement had a profound impact on his political views, shaping his commitment to democratic values and his opposition to authoritarianism.

He quickly rose through the party ranks, becoming a prominent figure in the PCI's youth organization. In the 1950s, Napolitano was involved in the PCI's efforts to support the Hungarian Revolution of 1956, which was a popular uprising against the Soviet-backed government in Hungary. Napolitano's involvement in the Hungarian Revolution marked a significant turning point in his political career, as he became increasingly committed to the principles of democracy and human rights.

He served in this role until 1994, when he was appointed as the Minister of the Interior in the government of Prime Minister Romano Prodi. As President of the Chamber of Deputies, Napolitano played a key role in shaping the country's legislative agenda, working to promote social and economic reform.

Late 1990s and Early 2000s

In the late 1990s and early 2000s, Napolitano continued to play a prominent role in Italian politics. He served as the Minister of the Interior from 1996 to 1999, overseeing a range of key policy areas, including public security, immigration, and law and order. He also played a key role in the development of the country's anti-terrorism laws, working to strengthen the country's defenses against terrorist threats.

President of Italy

His election marked a significant turning point in Italian politics, as he became the first President of Italy to be elected from outside the traditional party system.

# Indonesia at the 2023 ASEAN Para Games

The Indonesia team competed at the 2023 ASEAN Para Games, which were held in Phnom Penh, Cambodia from June 3 to June 9, 2023. The games featured nine sports and 22 disciplines, with a total of 1,255 athletes from 11 Southeast Asian nations participating.

## Medal Summary

Indonesia won a total of 143 medals at the 2023 ASEAN Para Games, consisting of 63 gold, 44 silver, and 36 bronze medals.
